column2:
NOUN

A back or side entrance.
as modifier ‘a small ___ door’

VERB

[WITH OBJECT]
Drink (something, especially an alcoholic drink) heartily.
‘he __d pint after pint of good Berkshire ale’

NOUN

mass noun
formal
The quality of having strong moral principles; honesty and decency.
‘financial ___’

NOUN

in singular
1A source of help in a difficult situation.
‘surgery may be the only ___’  
1.1 ___ tomass noun The use of (someone or something) as a source of help in a difficult situation.

VERB

[WITH OBJECT]
1Compress (something) into small folds or ridges.
‘she ___ the edge of the pie’  
1.1Connect (a wire or cable) by squeezing the end or ends.
‘pliers will ___ wires together’

ADJECTIVE

1Unpleasantly bright in colour, especially so as to create a harsh or unnatural effect.
‘___ food colourings’
‘a pair of ___ shorts’  
1.1Presented in vividly shocking or sensational terms.
